answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Megan – it seems the focus on new hires is to align new staff with the organizations goals, mission and Council objectives.  Less about their skills and abilities but more on the “big” picture.  Questions might include:

Are you familiar with the City’s mission, vision and values?  If so, do they align with your personal career goals?
The city’s 5-year vision is _______, how do you think you’ll be able to contribute to the vision?
What attracted you to apply for a position with the City of Charlottesville?

A speaker I heard at a TLG Conference once said we have a tentency to focus on the employees performance at the 3-month, 6-month, etc evaluations.  However, equally important is to ask:

Is Charlottesville the organization we said we were in our job annoucments, employee orientations, etc?
Who has been the most helpful person since you started?
a.  Send a thank you to that person and each person “up the escalation chain”
What do you need to continue being successful to ensure you pass probation?

Hope this is helpful.
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450
pmuse@transformgov.org

answers.author: Kenneth Decker
answers.text:
Describe the worst public hearing or meeting you have experienced as a planner?  What went wrong and how did you handle it?
Tell me about someone who you struggled to work with.  Describe the person.  How would that person describe you?
If I gave you a 30-page chapter of a community comprehensive plan to rewrite and asked you how long you needed... what would you tell me?

author: Megan Yaniglos
text:
We are going to be conducting interviews soon for a Senior Planner position and was wondering if anyone had some good, non standard interview questions? We have some standard ones, but am looking for some Planner specific, some that might show personality, and strong work ethic. 
I have looked through the documents section and didn't find anything. If you could just respond to this post or email me at myaniglos@albemarle.org, I would appreciate it! Interviews are going to take place next week.
Thanks!
title: Interview Questions
